data.enText: a period of time, usually in history, that is different from other periods because of particular characteristics or events

data.chText: 维多利亚 / 当今 / 战后时代
她离开公司后，一个时代结束了（后来的情况就大不一样了）。
data.enText: When she left the firm, it was the end of an era (= things were different after that) .
a length of time which is a division of an aeon

tr: a major division of geological time
an era is usually divided into two or more periods
a period marked by distinctive character or reckoned from a fixed point or event

value.def: You can refer to a period of history or a long period of time as an era when you want to draw attention to a particular feature or quality that it has.

example.ex: It was an era of austerity.

trans: 基督教时代；基督纪元；公元
